responses.topic: Meta AI Interactions and Commercial Intent
responses.content: Meta AI is on track to be the most used AI assistant in the world by the end of the year, boasting over 500 million monthly active users. Common interactions include information gathering, help with how-to tasks, deeper exploration of interests, content search within our services, and image generation. As Meta AI continues to grow in value for users, we anticipate a broadening set of queries, including those with commercial intent. Regarding building our own in-house search offering, we currently integrate with leading search engine partners like Bing and Google to provide sources for Meta AI's responses. We believe in leveraging these partnerships to enhance user experience without directly competing with established search providers.

AI is broadly applicable across our entire product suite, enhancing core business areas such as feed relevance, Reels, ad performance, ad creation, content creation, and integrity operations. Additionally, AI enables the development of entirely new services like Meta AI, Ray-Ban Meta Glasses, and AI Studio. These innovations not only improve existing products but also open up new monetization avenues. We're excited about the potential of AI Studio and Business AI to allow developers and businesses to create AI agents that enhance both consumer and business interactions on our platforms.

responses.topic: Llama Model Improvements and Infrastructure Scaling
responses.content: Improvements to the Llama models come in two main flavors: quality and efficiency. Developers and researchers leveraging our open-source Llama models contribute enhancements that we can incorporate back into our own products, such as Meta AI and AI Studio. This collaborative approach not only improves the models' performance but also drives cost efficiencies through industry-wide optimizations. On the infrastructure side, our teams are executing well, allowing us to build significant capacity. This scalability ensures that we can support the growing demands of Meta AI and future AI-driven products effectively.

responses.topic: AI Product Expansion and Future Opportunities
responses.content: Looking ahead, we're focused on expanding the capabilities of Meta AI and AI Studio to handle more complex tasks and serve as comprehensive assistants for both businesses and consumers. This includes integrating AI into smart glasses to provide real-time assistance and enhancing user experiences across all Meta platforms. Our roadmap includes developing advanced cognitive abilities and multimodal functionalities in future Llama models (up to Llama 7) to support these initiatives.

AI will play a significant role in content creation, enhancing the quality and relevance of content in feeds across Facebook, Instagram, and Threads. We're exploring AI-generated and AI-summarized content to make user experiences more engaging and personalized. These efforts align with our strategy to continuously innovate and improve content discovery and interaction on our platforms.

We've continued to drive ad performance improvements with strong year-over-year conversion growth. Our focus areas include creating engaging on-platform ad experiences with formats like click-to-message ads, Shops ads, and lead generation ads. We're also making it easier for advertisers to connect with their marketing data through features like conversions API and AEM, enhancing reporting and performance. Additionally, we're leveraging AI across our ads platform, scaling our Advantage+ suites to automate the ad creation process, which has delivered strong ROAS for advertisers.

We've developed a new model architecture to power multiple recommendation products, initially validating it with Facebook Reels and seeing significant performance gains. This architecture will be extended to other video recommendation areas, aiming to unlock more relevant content recommendations over time. On the ad side, our Meta Lattice model consolidates specialized models into larger ones, improving ad performance across various services and objectives. We expect to enhance these models further in 2024 to support more conversion types and drive continued ad performance improvements.

We're seeing strong adoption of our generative AI ad creative features, especially image expansion among small businesses. These tools help advertisers create personalized ads at scale, improving ROAS and driving sales. On the business AI side, we're testing AI chats with a few businesses on Messenger and WhatsApp, which have received positive feedback for saving time and providing timely responses to customers. We'll continue expanding these tests to enhance the usefulness and performance of our AI tools for advertisers in 2024 and 2025.

Our messaging monetization efforts focus on click-to-messaging ads and paid messaging. Click-to-messaging ads have shown strong revenue growth and broad advertiser adoption. We're enhancing optimization and reporting to drive performance and enabling businesses to optimize for purchases. Paid messaging is in early stages but shows good momentum, especially with marketing messages and our updated pricing model. We're testing features like AI chats with businesses and enhancing user experiences within WhatsApp to drive monetization.

Online commerce remains one of our strongest verticals. Our Advantage+ tools, especially Advantage+ Shopping, continue to drive strong performance and conversions for advertisers. We're making it easier for businesses to onboard Shops on Facebook and Instagram, enhancing integrations with partners like Shopify, and leveraging AI to improve Shops ads' performance. Our partnership with Amazon for Buy with Prime is an early test to create a seamless shopping experience, which we're expanding further based on positive adoption.

Advantage+ has seen significant traction, particularly Advantage+ Audience, which has led to a 28% decrease in cost per click or per objective compared to regular targeting. Our end-to-end automation products like Advantage+ Shopping and Advantage+ App campaigns have more than doubled in revenue since last year. We're continuing to enhance these tools, expand conversion types, and integrate generative AI features to drive further adoption and performance improvements.

responses.topic: CapEx Outlook and Data Center Architecture
responses.content: We're transitioning to a new data center architecture that supports both AI and non-AI workloads more efficiently. This new design is cost-effective and quicker to build, providing greater flexibility to scale based on demand. In 2023, we adjusted our CapEx forecast downward by $3 billion to $5 billion due to delays in data center projects and server deliveries. For 2024, we expect CapEx to increase as we ramp up construction of new data centers and invest in AI infrastructure, aiming to realize cost efficiencies and support our expanding AI initiatives.

Marketplace is a key component of our broader commerce strategy, focusing on creating the best shopping experience on our platform. We've seen strong engagement and adoption among young adults, driven by product improvements and high demand for second-hand products. We're exploring monetization opportunities by enhancing ad targeting within Marketplace and integrating with Shops ads to streamline the shopping experience for users and advertisers alike.

G&A growth in Q1 was primarily driven by legal expenses, including accruals related to ongoing legal matters. Detailed information will be available in our 10-Q filing. Overall, we've maintained a disciplined approach to allocating new resources, focusing on core company priorities and ensuring efficient operations within the Family of Apps business.

Advantage+ tools continue to drive strong ad performance and adoption across various verticals. We've introduced new conversion types and generative AI features to enhance ad creation and optimization. These improvements have led to increased ROAS and revenue growth, particularly among small businesses leveraging tools like Advantage+ Shopping and Advantage+ Audience.

questions: Mark, can you help us understand some of the more recurring types of interactions or query types you're seeing with Meta AI and whether they have commercial intent? How do you think about building your own in-house search offering as opposed to partnering with another player?
Susan, regarding headcount, how do we think about relative headcount investments into 2025 to support all that infrastructure versus what you've been doing in 2024?

Mark, I wanted to understand better what you continue to learn about the biggest opportunity sets to apply AI to your platform, product portfolio, and internal processes. What are your key learnings as you go through the business planning process?
Mark, can you talk more about the functionality of Meta AI as agents are introduced and how you expect use cases to expand beyond longer and more complex queries?
Susan, regarding CapEx, you mentioned $15 billion to $17 billion in CapEx in Q4. Should we think about this as a run rate into 2025?
How are you able to utilize AI internally, and are you seeing big productivity gains in your R&D group?
Susan, how flexible is your headcount as you think about cost growth in other areas?

Susan, regarding the revenue guidance and outlook, can you share any color on the state of the overall digital ad market? You've highlighted areas of strength versus your efforts to improve the efficacy of the ad product.
Mark, how do you think about the next leg of monetization growth from Reels and Threads? Specifically, beyond ad insertion, any color on the roadmap?
As you look out through the coming period of product investment, how should we think about the relationship between Family of Apps revenue and cost growth?
Can you provide insight into the elevated G&A growth in Q1, specifically regarding legal expenses? Are there any one-time items causing this?
Mark, how are you using improvements from third-party developers working on Llama to incubate new ideas inside Meta?
Regarding capacity, with Llama 3.1 trained on 16,000 H100s and planning 600,000 by year-end, how are you modeling out the entire CapEx roadmap between training, inference, and future needs?
Are there any plans to open Llama 3.1 to the broader web, similar to OpenAI's testing? Can it be linked to third-party marketplaces for commercial search?
Can you elaborate on the opportunity to deepen your relationship with EssilorLuxottica regarding Ray-Ban? What areas are most exciting in that partnership?

topics: Impact of Major Events on Revenue
questions: Susan, how much of the revenue might come from unusual events like major elections and sports events in 2024? How much impact might these have on comps?
Can you talk about WhatsApp monetization and where you are now versus the future? How far away are you from optimization?
